org.jlab.coda.xmsg.examples

Class Publisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.xmsg.core.xMsg
      • org.jlab.coda.xmsg.examples.Publisher

  • public class Publisher
extends xMsg
    An example of a publisher that publishes data required size in kBytes for ever. He does not care who is subscribing to his data.
    Since:
    11/4/14

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Publisher()
      Constructor, requires the name of the FrontEnd host that is used to create a connection to the registrar service running within the xMsgFE.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Publisher

        public Publisher()
          throws xMsgException,
                 java.net.SocketException

        Constructor, requires the name of the FrontEnd host that is used to create a connection to the registrar service running within the xMsgFE. Creates the zmq context object and thread pool for servicing received messages in a separate threads. Localhost is considered to be the host of the FE. Thread pool is relevant for subscribers only.

        Throws:
        xMsgException
        java.net.SocketException
